name: Appropriation

name: Bail Reform
definition: Reducing reliance on cash bail (where only rich people can afford to leave jail before trial) and using risk assessment instead. Keeps dangerous people locked up, releases low-risk people, saves money.
full_text: Reducing reliance on cash bail (where only rich people can afford to leave jail before trial) and using risk assessment instead. Keeps dangerous people locked up, releases low-risk people, saves money.

name: Balanced Budget
definition: Revenue equals expenditures - no deficit spending. Required by law for Louisville. Dave's budget is fully balanced.
full_text: Revenue equals expenditures - no deficit spending. Required by law for Louisville. Dave's budget is fully balanced.

name: Bond
definition: A loan the city takes out for major capital projects (like building a new library). Paid back over many years, similar to a mortgage.
full_text: A loan the city takes out for major capital projects (like building a new library). Paid back over many years, similar to a mortgage.

name: Budget Variance
definition: The difference between what was budgeted and what was actually spent. If we budget $10M for roads and spend $12M, the variance is $2M over. We track this in real-time so you can hold us accountable.
full_text: The difference between what was budgeted and what was actually spent. If we budget $10M for roads and spend $12M, the variance is $2M over. We track this in real-time so you can hold us accountable.

name: Capital Budget
definition: Money spent on long-term assets like buildings, roads, and equipment that last multiple years. If it lasts longer than one year, it's usually "capital" spending. Building a mini substation is capital; paying the officers who work there is operating.
full_text: Money spent on long-term assets like buildings, roads, and equipment that last multiple years. If it lasts longer than one year, it's usually "capital" spending. Building a mini substation is capital; paying the officers who work there is operating.

name: Capital Outlay
definition: Purchases of equipment, vehicles, or infrastructure that last multiple years. A new fire truck is capital outlay. Gasoline for the fire truck is operating expense.
full_text: Purchases of equipment, vehicles, or infrastructure that last multiple years. A new fire truck is capital outlay. Gasoline for the fire truck is operating expense.

name: Co-Responder Model
definition: Police officer + mental health professional responding together to certain calls. Better outcomes, safer for everyone.
full_text: Police officer + mental health professional responding together to certain calls. Better outcomes, safer for everyone.

name: Community Detective
